description: The software shall initialize all ARINC-429 hardware interfaces within 500 ms of power-on.
The software shall compute a Brake Pressure Command based on valid Pilot Pedal inputs.
The software shall provide Antiskid protection when the aircraft speed is above 20 knots.
The software shall inhibit all braking when the Touchdown Protection logic is active.

The software shall transition to "Manual Bypass" mode upon detection of a critical system failure.
The software shall monitor the health of the ARINC-429 input bus and declare a "Bus Fault" if no data is received for 200 ms.
The software shall provide a Continuous Built-In Test (CBIT) for sensor out-of-range detection.
The software shall perform a Power-up Built-In Test (PBIT) to verify valve coil continuity.
The software shall command the Parking Brake valve based on the discrete lever input.
The software shall synchronize wheel speed data across redundant channels.

The software shall calculate Aircraft Reference Speed based on the highest filtered wheel speed.
The software shall manage the "Weight on Wheels" (WoW) persistence timer.
The software shall transmit BCS Health Status on ARINC-429 Label 270.
The software shall provide Locked-Wheel protection if one wheel speed is <30% of the reference speed.
The software shall provide a maintenance interface for retrieving stored fault codes.
The software shall implement a hardware watchdog timer.
The software shall maintain a "Ready" state only when all internal diagnostic tests pass.
The software shall apply a differential braking offset for unequal pedal inputs.
